page.title: 18Death on the Dunes
page.content: The sand dunes between Hartley and St Marys is a good place to have a picnic but on 12th 1864 such an event ended in tragedy for a party of Seaton Delaval people. They were accosted by a miner named Bell who demanded money from William Moore. Bell drew a gun and shot Moore in the thigh, he died several hours later. Bell was taken away and sentenced to six years imprisonment. In the autumn of 1739 a gibbet could be seen on Curry's point holding a body. Hanging there was Michael Curry, recently executed for the murder of Robert Sheuil a Hartley landlord. It was thought that Curry had been incited by the mans wife but while confessing his guilt he denied this claim. From that time on the spot where the gibbet stood has been known as Curry's point
